definition: a wooden or bamboo pen for sheep or cattle/wood or bamboo trestlework/a warehouse

sentences.english: Factories and warehouses edge the waterfront.
sentences.chinese: 工厂和货栈林立在江边。

sentences.english: Baths were taken in the warehouse once a week by carrying hot water to the tub.
sentences.chinese: 货栈成了洗澡的地方，每周一次，热水是打到。

sentences.english: So, the study on two-warehouse inventory models has expansive foreground.
sentences.chinese: 因此，研究两货栈库存模型有广阔的应用前景。

sentences.english: The shops and warehouses are all closed.
The large warehouse backs on to the river.
Bales of rubber were being weighed at a godown.
sentences.chinese: 当时大包的橡胶正在货栈被称重。

sentences.english: A beam of yellow light seemed to welcome them to the fur-trading post.
sentences.chinese: 一束黄色的灯光似乎在欢迎他们光临这个皮毛货栈。

sentences.english: They came slowly along the dusty street of warehouses.
sentences.chinese: 他们沿着货栈中布满灰尘的街道慢慢走来。

sentences.english: Throughout the city were the great mansions and warehouses of the merchants.
sentences.chinese: 商人的豪宅和货栈遍布整座城市。

sentences.english: Well, I can put them in the airport storage, then.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，那么，我可以把它们放在机场货栈里。

sentences.english: Outside the city, enormous warehouses stretch for miles.
sentences.chinese: 城外，巨大的货栈群延伸数英里。

definition: money farm (dealing in illegal foreign currency of money laundering)
